DynamicAlerting

Class MPulseApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • DynamicAlerting.MPulseApplication

  • public class MPulseApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    Each mPulse application object represents an interface to a particular application in the mPulse system. You can have many mPulse applications defined.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MPulseApplication(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String apiKey)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MPulseApplication

        public MPulseApplication(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         java.lang.String apiKey)
        Parameters:
        name - A friendly name for this particular mPulse Application
        username - A username with data permissions to this mPulse Application
        password - The password for the username with data permissions to this mPulse application
        apiKey - The API key for this particular mPulse Application

    • Method Detail

      • getApplicationCount

        public static int getApplicationCount()
        Returns:
        the number of Applications that have been defined so far

      • getApplicationNames

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getApplicationNames()
        Returns:
        the list of mPulse applications names which have already been defined

      • requestmPulseToken

        public java.lang.String requestmPulseToken()
        Calls he mPulse API to create the token that will be used for all future requests.
        Returns:
        The token value (after setting the token for the current MPulseApplication)

      • mPulseQuery

        public java.lang.String mPulseQuery(java.lang.String queryString)
        Calls the mPulse API to retrieve information.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The entire queryString for a request to the mPulse API. Essentially this everything to the right of the question mark in the following sample mPulse request:\n\t
          https://mpulse.soasta.com/concerto/mpulse/api/v2/XXXXX-YYYYY-ZZZZZ-XXXXX-YYYYY/summary?date=2013-05-10
        Returns:
        the response to the API request.
